import Mathlib

/-!
Let (X,d) be a metric space. Let C_b(X,â„) be the set of bounded continuous functions X â†’ â„
with metric d(f,g) := sup_{x âˆˆ X} |f(x)-g(x)|.
Show that (C_b(X,â„),d) is a metric space and that convergence in d is equivalent to uniform convergence.
-/

noncomputable section

open Filter

variable {X : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X]

-- Bounded continuous real-valued functions on X
def Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- Supremum (uniform) distance on bounded continuous functions. -/
def sup_dist (f g : Cb) : â„ := â¨† (x : X), |(f : X â†’ â„) x - (g : X â†’ â„) x|

instance : Dist Cb := âŸ¨sup_distâŸ©

/-- The space of bounded continuous real-valued functions with the supremum distance is a metric space. -/
theorem metric_space_Cb : MetricSpace Cb := by sorry

/-- Convergence in the sup metric is equivalent to uniform convergence. -/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {Î± : Type _} {u : Filter Î±} {F : Î± â†’ Cb} {f : Cb} :
  Tendsto F u (ğ“ f) â†”
    (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆ€á¶  n in u, âˆ€ x, |(F n : X â†’ â„) x - (f : X â†’ â„) x| < Îµ) := by sorry

end noncomputable section

import Mathlib

/-!
Let (X,d) be a metric space. Let C_b(X,â„) be the set of bounded continuous functions X â†’ â„
with metric d(f,g) := sup_{x âˆˆ X} |f(x)-g(x)|.
Show that (C_b(X,â„),d) is a metric space and that convergence in d is equivalent to uniform convergence.
-/

noncomputable section

variable {X : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X]

-- Bounded continuous real-valued functions on X
abbrev Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- The space Cb(X, â„) is a metric space (sup metric). -/
theorem metric_space_Cb : MetricSpace Cb := by sorry

/-- Convergence in the sup metric is equivalent to uniform convergence. -/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {Î± : Type _} {u : Filter Î±} {F : Î± â†’ Cb} {f : Cb} :
  Tendsto F u (ğ“ f) â†”
    (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆ€á¶  n in u, âˆ€ x : X, |(â‡‘(F n) x) - (â‡‘f x)| < Îµ) := by sorry

end noncomputable section
